thread.title: Storm Doris weather bomb lashes UK with 90mph winds seeing boy hit by falling tree
thread.title_full: Storm Doris weather bomb lashes UK with 90mph winds seeing boy hit by falling tree

title: Storm Doris weather bomb lashes UK with 90mph winds seeing boy hit by falling tree
text:
Storm Doris weather bomb lashes UK with 90mph winds seeing boy hit by falling tree Storm Doris weather bomb lashes UK with 90mph winds seeing boy hit by falling tree STORM DORIS is bringing violent weather smashing into the UK today as drivers are warned to stay off the roads and hurriance-like winds cross the sea. PUBLISHED: 08:54, Thu, Feb 23, 2017 | UPDATED: 09:25, Thu, Feb 23, 2017 TWITTER/INSTAGRAM Snow and high winds crash into UK as Storm Doris hits 
Flights have been grounded and bridges shut in anticipation of destruction brought by the raging storm. 
Huge 87mph winds have been recorded as, power cuts and up to an inch of snow are expected by forecasters. 
The worst of the storm will hit the country today while weather warnings are in place for Scotland, Northumberland, Birmingham and the northern edges of the home counties. 
Road, rail and airports are expected to see major problems. 
Dozens of flights have been cancelled out of London by companies including Aer Lingus which cancelled 12 flights between the UK and the Republic of Ireland. 
A teenager was rushed to hospital on Wednesday when a tree crashed down on him in Bristol. 
Clive Thomas, an off-duty police officer told the Bristol Post the 13-year-old was hit on the back as he and a group of friends walked along the road. Related articles
